alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:29AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cherry County through 315 AM CDT... At 228 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Merritt Reservoir, or 14 miles southwest of Valentine, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area and Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 97 between mile markers 120 and 133. Highway 83 between mile markers 186 and 203. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
